claim_ui_checks.claim: Complete procedure: Calculate Daily Pay for Unpaid Leave Deduction

checks.name: behavioral_DWC_002
checks.claim_text: Complete procedure: Calculate Daily Pay for Unpaid Leave Deduction
checks.validation_hint: Preconditions: When an unpaid leave request is approved and a salary deduction needs to be generated for the payroll system. || Steps: Receive and approve the unpaid leave request -> Determine the applicable leave policy type (calendar days or working days) -> Identify the total number of days in the policy (e.g., 30 calendar days or 22 working days) -> Identify all public holidays falling within the month of calculation -> Subtract public holidays from the total working days to obtain actual working days -> Retrieve the employee's total salary amount (Basic + Allowance) -> Apply the formula: Daily Pay = Salary Amount / Actual Working Days -> System automatically creates the pay deduction and reflects it on the payroll table || Expected: Procedure completes without blocking validation errors | System shows success confirmation (toast/banner) OR state persists after refresh

claim_ui_checks.claim: Complete procedure: Configure Daily Wage Calculator

checks.name: behavioral_DWC_003
checks.claim_text: Complete procedure: Configure Daily Wage Calculator
checks.validation_hint: Preconditions: When setting up or updating daily wage calculation methodology for payroll processing. || Steps: Navigate to Settings from the main menu -> Select Payroll from the settings options -> Click on Daily Wage Calculation -> Select the desired calculation base: calendar days, working days, or custom days -> Choose which salary components to include in the calculation -> Apply the configuration to activate the daily wage calculation method || Expected: Procedure completes without blocking validation errors | System shows success confirmation (toast/banner) OR state persists after refresh

faq_candidates.question: What happens if I change the calculation method mid-month?
faq_candidates.answer: Changes typically apply to future calculations. Check with your payroll administrator for specific timing.

faq_candidates.question: Does this affect existing payroll runs?
faq_candidates.answer: Generally, changes only affect future payroll calculations, not already processed runs.

calculation_examples.title: Employee with AED 10,000 Monthly Salary

calculations.note: Based on typical working days excluding weekends
Uses actual days in the specific month

calculation_examples.impact_note: The calculation method affects leave deductions, overtime pay, and end-of-service calculations

use_cases.situation: An employee takes unpaid leave and you need to calculate the salary deduction
use_cases.solution: The daily rate setting determines how much to deduct per day of unpaid leave
use_cases.example: Employee on 3 days unpaid leave with daily rate of AED 333.33 = AED 1,000 deduction

use_cases.situation: An employee is leaving the company and you need to calculate their final settlement
use_cases.solution: The daily rate is used to compute gratuity and remaining balance calculations
use_cases.example: Daily rate determines the per-day value for gratuity calculations

navigation_validation_report.disclaimer: Navigation paths are sourced from Zendesk documentation and serve as GUIDANCE ONLY. The actual UI may differ as menus change over time. Failed paths indicate potential documentation updates needed, NOT system errors. Conceptual process flows (business workflows) are identified using procedures context and are NOT treated as clickable menu paths.

evidence.caveat: Navigation paths are from Zendesk docs (guidance only). Actual UI may differ.

paths.recommendation: Path verified - can be used in user guide

conceptual_flows.breadcrumb: Unpaid Leave Request → Approval → Automatic Pay Deduction Generation → Payroll Table Reflection
